Name: Far Traveler
Description: You have come to this land from a distant place, perhaps a far-off region of the same world, or an entirely different world. You might be a refugee, a former soldier, a nomad, a pilgrim, or a merchant. You might have set out on your own or with a larger group of travelers. Perhaps you are undertaking a quest, or you are searching for a place to settle. In any case, you are far from home, and the land and its people are strange to you.

Tool Proficiency.1: One type of musical instrument or gaming set

Equipment.2: Any one musical instrument or gaming set you are proficient with
Equipment.3: poorly wrought maps from your homeland that depict where you are in Faerun
Equipment.4: A small piece of jewelry worth 10 gp in the style of your homeland's craftsmanship

Feature.All Eyes on You: Your accent, mannerisms, figures of speech, and perhaps even your appearance all mark you as foreign. Curious glances are directed your way wherever you go, which can be a nuisance, but you also gain the friendly interest of those who are eager to hear what you have to say. You can parley this attention into access to people and places you might not otherwise have, for you and your traveling companions. Noble lords, scholars, and merchant princes, just to name a few, might be interested in hearing about your distant homeland and people.

Personality Trait.1: I have different assumptions from those around me concerning personal space, blithely invading others' space in innocence, or reacting to ignorant invasion of my own.
Personality Trait.2: I have my own ideas about what is and is not food, and I find the eating habits of those around me fascinating, confusing, or revolting.
Personality Trait.3: I have a strong code of honor or sense of propriety that others don't comprehend.
Personality Trait.4: I express affection or contempt in ways that are unfamiliar to others.
Personality Trait.5: I honor my deities through practices that are foreign to this land.
Personality Trait.6: I begin or end my day with small traditional rituals that are unfamiliar to those around me.

Ideal.1: Open. I have much to learn from the kindly people I meet along my way. (Good)
Ideal.2: Reserved. As someone new to these strange lands, I am cautious and respectful in my dealings. (Lawful)
Ideal.3: Adventure. I'm far from home, and everything is strange and wonderful! (Chaotic)
Ideal.4: Cunning. Though I may not know their ways, neither do they know mine, which can be to my advantage. (Evil)
Ideal.5: Inquisitive. Everything is new, but I have a thirst to learn. (Neutral)
Ideal.6: Suspicious. I must be careful, for I have no way of telling friend from foe here. (Any)

Bond.1: So long as I have this token from my homeland, I can face any adversity in this strange land.
Bond.2: The gods of my people are a comfort to me so far from home.
Bond.3: I hold no greater cause than my service to my people.
Bond.4: My freedom is my most precious possession. I'll never let anyone take it from me again.
Bond.5: I'm fascinated by the beauty and wonder of this new land.
Bond.6: Though I had no choice, I lament having to leave my loved ones behind. I hope to see them again one day.

Flaw.1: I am secretly (or not so secretly) convinced of the superiority of my own culture over that of this foreign land.
Flaw.2: I pretend not to understand the local language in order to avoid interactions I would rather not have.
Flaw.3: I have a weakness for the new intoxicants and other pleasures of this land.
Flaw.4: I don't take kindly to some of the actions and motivations of the people of this land, because these folk are different from me.
Flaw.5: I consider the adherents of other gods to be deluded innocents at best, or ignorant fools at worst.
Flaw.6: I have a weakness for the new intoxicants and other pleasures of this land.
